text: β-Lysine (3,6-diaminohexanoic acidcurehunter.com > beta-lysine Retrieved on April 18, 2010) is an amino acid produced by platelets during coagulation and is directly antibacterial by causing lysis of many Gram positive bacteria by acting as a cationic detergent.IMMUNOLOGY - CHAPTER ONE > INNATE (NON- SPECIFIC) IMMUNITY Gene Mayer, Ph.D. Immunology Section of Microbiology and Immunology On-line. title: Beta-Lysine
